perturbation.original_text: The obligations of the Agent pursuant to this Agreement shall terminate upon termination of the Offering, but in no event later than 45 days after  the completion of the Subscription Offering (the "End Date"). All fees or expenses due to the Agent but unpaid will be payable to the Agent in  next day funds at the earlier of the Closing Date (as hereinafter defined) or the End Date.
perturbation.changed_text: The obligations of the Agent pursuant to this Agreement shall terminate upon termination of the Offering, but in no event later than 45 days after the completion of the Subscription Offering (the "End Date"). All fees or expenses due to the Agent but unpaid will be payable to the Agent in next day funds within 10 business days of the End Date.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating fees are payable within 10 business days of the End Date, contradicting the earlier statement that fees are payable at the earlier of the Closing Date or the End Date. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: Not later than  two days prior to the Closing Date, the Agent will provide the Company with an accounting of all reimbursable expenses to be paid at the Closing  in next day funds. In the event the Bank determines to abandon or terminate the Conversion prior to Closing, payment of such expenses shall be  made in next day funds on the date such determination is made.
perturbation.changed_text: Not later than two days prior to the Closing Date, the Agent will provide the Company with an accounting of all reimbursable expenses. The Company shall remit payment within 30 days of receipt of the accounting. In the event the Bank determines to abandon or terminate the Conversion prior to Closing, payment of such expenses shall be made in next day funds on the date such determination is made.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated reimbursable expenses are to be paid at the Closing. The changed text now states the company remits payment within 30 days of receiving the account. This directly contradicts the prior statement, introducing uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: Subsequent to the date the Registration Statement is declared effective by the Commission and prior to the Closing Date, except as otherwise  may be indicated or contemplated therein or set forth in an amendment or supplement thereto, neither the Company nor the Bank will have: (i)  issued any securities or incurred any liability or obligation, direct or contingent, for borrowed money, except borrowings from the same or similar sources indicated in the Prospectus in the ordinary course of its business, or (ii) entered into any transaction  which is material in light of the business and properties of the Company and the Bank, taken as a whole.
perturbation.changed_text: Subsequent to the date the Registration Statement is declared effective by the Commission and prior to the Closing Date, except as otherwise may be indicated or contemplated therein or set forth in an amendment or supplement thereto, neither the Company nor the Bank will have: (i) issued any securities or incurred any liability or obligation, direct or contingent, for borrowed money, except borrowings from the same or similar sources indicated in the Prospectus in the ordinary course of its business, or (ii) entered into any transaction which is immaterial in light of the business and properties of the Company and the Bank, taken as a whole.
perturbation.explanation: The changed text states transactions must be 'immaterial' while the original text stated transactions must be 'material'. This creates a contradiction and could affect how the contract is enforced.
